content.rendered:
8 October 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its rapid international expansion and opens an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Malaysia is the 14th country AqualisBraemar, which is part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, enters after the company was established in 2013.

“Malaysia holds substantial proven oil and gas reserves from its offshore fields. There are a lot of activities offshore the Peninsular basin in the west and the Sarawak and Sabah basins in the east. We have already had numerous requests to support existing clients operating offshore Malaysia, and having an official presence in KL will facilitate servicing all existing and new clients in Malaysia more efficiently,” says Phil Lenox, Director – Asia Pacific, AqualisBraemar.

The Kuala Lumpur office will offer AqualisBraemar’s full range of services with support from other group offices. However, its initial focus will be on transportation and installation, marine warranty services and engineering.

AqualisBraemar is a specialized marine and offshore engineering consultancy focusing on the shallow and deep-water segments of the offshore oil and gas industry.

excerpt.rendered: 8 October 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its rapid international expansion and opens an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar set for Malaysian adjusting push
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The central bank of Malaysia, Bank Negara Malaysia, has formally sanctioned international consultancy AqualisBraemar to handle insurance claims in Malaysia.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to South Korea

jetpack-related-posts.title: Rig inspection contract to AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Brunei Shell Petroleum Company Sdn Bhd (BSP) has awarded AqualisBraemar a frame agreement to conduct rig inspection services for the operator.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Major milestone for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has completed its 1,000th leg penetration assessment, which took place offshore Saudi Arabia.  The company’s 1,000th leg penetration assessment (LPA) was conducted for Teras Offshore, for the Teras Conquest 7 self-elevating liftboat, at the MNIF 5 wellhead platform at the MANIFA field, offshore Saudi Arabia. jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar enters Aberdeen
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 1 June 2015 – International marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar bucks the oil market trend to establish an office in Aberdeen, Scotland. “We know that job cuts currently is a common theme in the oil industry, but we are taking a long-term approach. jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar and HOSE International enter inspection partnership
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar and HOSE International have signed a memorandum of understanding to jointly provide rig and well control inspection services for the offshore industry.
